trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.SessionSecurityTokenCreated"></xref> event and for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationAuthenticationModule.SessionSecurityTokenCreated"></xref> event.

In the session authentication module (SAM) the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.SessionSecurityTokenCreated> event is raised from within the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.OnAuthenticateRequest%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method after a session token (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken>) has been created.
This happens, for example, if an event handler for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.SessionSecurityTokenReceived> event modifies the token.

You can use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenCreatedEventArgs> to modify the session token before it is passed further along the pipeline and is used to authenticate the entity making the request (user).

In the WS-Federation authentication module (WSFAM), the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationAuthenticationModule.SessionSecurityTokenCreated> event is raised from the request processing pipeline just after a session token has been created from the WS-Federation sign-in response message received from the STS and just before the SAM is called to set the thread principal and write the session cookie.
You can use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenCreatedEventArgs.SessionToken%2A> property to modify or replace the token.
You can set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenCreatedEventArgs.WriteSessionCookie%2A> to specify whether the session cookie should be written (or re-written).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenCreatedEventArgs"></xref> class by using the specified session security token.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenCreatedEventArgs.SessionToken%2A> property is set to the token specified by the `sessionToken` parameter.
The session security token that was created.
Gets or sets the session security token that was created.
The session token that was created.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a cookie should be written in the response.
`true` to write a cookie in the response; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`, the cookie is not written in the response.
